page.title: 07 Dairy Farm, near Wootton.
page.content: The farm, which is rented from the local authority, is in two parts for administrative reasons and is run by two parts of the same family. It mainly concentrates on milk production on its 150 acres but there is also a riding school with horses kept in stables on the farm. In the modern milking parlour about 70 cows are milked twice a day in one and a half hours by two men. There is a computerised system for giving individual amounts of food to the cows as they are being milked. Milk from from both parts of the farm is stored separately in two cooled tanks and is collected every morning by tanker. The equipment includes five tractors, a combine harvester, a Landrover, ploughs, trailers and a forage harvester.
